config_model.deleteModelInstanceError: Module instance with instance id "{id}" does not exist.
config_model.evseIdCountWarning: Module "{instanceId}" has EVSE ID {evseId} but only {evseManagerCount} EvseManager modules exist.
config_model.interfaceMismatchError: The interface for the provide ({provider}) and the requirement ({requirement}) do not match
config_model.moduleExistsError: Module instance with id: {moduleId} already exists
config_model.moduleImplementationCountWarning: Module "{instanceId}" implementation "{implementationName}" has EVSE ID {evseId} but only {evseManagerCount} EvseManager modules exist.
config_model.moduleInvalidError: Invalid module type: {type}. Are you running in simulator mode? If yes, this likely means this version of the Admin Panel in simulator mode doesn't support this module yet. Make sure you are running the correct admin panel or connect to a live instance.
config_model.providingInstanceDoesNotExistError: Providing instance with instance id {instanceId} does not exist. Are you running in simulator mode? If yes, this likely means this version of the Admin Panel in simulator mode doesn't support this interface yet. Make sure you are running the correct admin panel or connect to a live instance.
config_model.providingModuleDoesNotProvideError: Providing module of type "{moduleType}" does not provide an implementation named "{implementationName}". Are you running in simulator mode? If yes, this likely means this version of the Admin Panel in simulator mode doesn't support this yet. Make sure you are running the correct admin panel or connect to a live instance.
config_model.requiringInstanceDoesNotExistError: Requiring instance with instance id {instanceId} does not exist. Are you running in simulator mode? If yes, this likely means this version of the Admin Panel in simulator mode doesn't support this interface yet. Make sure you are running the correct admin panel or connect to a live instance.
config_model.requiringModuleDoesNotRequireError: Requiring module of type "{moduleType}" does not have an requirement called "{requirementName}". Are you running in simulator mode? If yes, this likely means this version of the Admin Panel in simulator mode doesn't support this yet. Make sure you are running the correct admin panel or connect to a live instance.

componentDefinition.simulatorMockHint: Mock EVerest Instance for testing: simulates behavior without real data transmission. Not perfect, but useful for development.

instanceForm.portInvalidError: Please enter a valid port number.

createConfig.validateConfigNameCharacters: The name must only contain letters, numbers, dashes, and underscores
createConfig.validateConfigNameFileExtension: The name must not contain the file extension

evModuleInfo.configureMappingText1: Configure EVSE and connector mappings for this module.
evModuleInfo.configureMappingText2: Choose EVSE IDs from 0 to the number of EvseManager modules in your configuration.
evModuleInfo.configureMappingTooltip: EVSE ID 0 = entire charging station, EVSE IDs 1+ = individual charging points
evModuleInfo.configureSpecificMappings: Advanced: Configure specific mappings for individual implementations
evModuleInfo.implementationConnectorIdHint: Connector ID for this implementation (1-4 typical, optional)
evModuleInfo.moduleConnectorIdHint: Connector ID for this module (1-4 typical, optional)
evModuleInfo.moduleEvseIdHint: EVSE ID for this module (0 = charging station level)
evModuleInfo.title: Module instance information
